title: Tell me one reason to reconect to a game
body:
My pc crashed, i joined back to a game.
I managed to catch up and we won the game.
I got 20 mins 5 games leaver buster and still lost lp for that game
Considering this, give me one good reason to reconect to the game.

Edit: downvote me to hell, im ok with that. This is one of those situations everybody would claim to do whats morally/socially/etc correct but if the situation actually came in they would'nt give a fuck about whats morally or socially correct. 

Second edit: never thought a post of mine could get so uch atention, thank you all {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}} 

Third edit: let me clear some confusion to all who try to pull the *insert outrageous voice ''oh but you need to leave S E V E R A L! times to get a leave buster, so yaknow, thats bullshit!!11''. I wont enter in long detail. Just consider this. I didnt play for 8 months, and i started playing again. The first game i went afk after those 8 months was a 20 min leave buster. So stop claiming the system to work as you want it to, and accept reality.

replies.body:
I think LeaverBuster should be less strict for people who rejoin.

Recently, there was a **MAAJOOR** fiber cut here in the southeast that affected several ISPs. It was due to the winter storm. Infrastructure in the southeast doesn't really do well in the cold (we're very, very resistant to burying our data lines, keeping them on telephone poles :P). This fiber cut was a LONG way from where I live. It was a major line further up north in Georgia. But the fiber failure affected people far away from the cut, from NC all the way down to Alabama and Florida.

I came back to the game, caught up, contributed, and even WON.... aaaaaaaaaaand... I was penalized and received nothing for that game (it was norms) due to "AFK behavior". Now apply this to a ranked game. To work extra hard to catch up and receive nothing because of an automated system.

I don't support Leavers... but I don't think the automated systems should be so strict as they are now. There are times when there are just extenuating circumstances. Instead, the systems should only automatically take action if someone reports.

I remember in season 3 when I played a toplane game as malphite I suddenly lost internet 8 minutes in. After half an hour my internet finally was restored and I could reconnect to the game that was 40 minutes in. We won shortly after and I still got LP and no punishment.

League a few years back was so much better. Not saying it is fine to afk and return when you feel like so and I am not saying that I deserved to get the LP back then as I did nothing that counted for the win, but I say that it is wrong to take your lp and give you a punishment when you actually get back to the game and played a big role in winning the game.

Sorry, don't buy it.  

20 minute queue for five games means you left multiple games in a row.  If your computer is that bad then League is not the game for you. 

My suspicion is that you were tilted and left a few games and, sure, maybe one game your PC did actually crash, but that's not the exclusive reason that you got a Leaverbuster penalty and you know that.  Stop trying to get sympathy from the Boards on a false premise.

I can leave one game and get stuck in 5 20 minute queue games. It isn't because I'm toxic (honor 5 and I rarely tilt) nor because I want to leave games. In fact today I reported someone who afk'ed entire game because our jungler's game crashed and it took them 15 minutes to reconnect. They could not have been more toxic about it. Rather I get placed in 20 minute queue because several months ago I left too many games due to a combination of IRL stuff taking precedence or my connection going out and refusing to come back at inopportune times.

Since then my connection has (largely) been fixed but I leave once in a while because IRL things demand it. I'd love to finish a game but sometimes I just can't. I don't see how its fair to punish me for things that are outside my control, nor do I understand why you're making assumptions that this guy is lying when he has a perfectly valid point.

> [{quoted}](name=AdmiralMunson,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=El3y1F0P,comment-id=00180000,timestamp=2017-12-17T08:45:46.161+0000)
>
> I can leave one game and get stuck in 5 20 minute queue games.

You actually cannot.  The system does not work that way.  I have had friends that have left games and have not received a penalty, the only thing that happens is you get a message that *warns* you about leaving games and you must agree to not do it again by typing "I Agree".  So long as you do not leave any more games for a fairly lengthy period of time then you will not receive any further sanctions.  That's how the system works.  

 >It isn't because I'm toxic (honor 5 and I rarely tilt) nor because I want to leave games.

Leaverbuster is simply about leaving games, period.  Irrespective of your reasons, Leaverbuster flags you if you leave games repeatedly or even infrequently and you can get penalized... this does not apply to just ONE game, however.  

 
>I don't see how its fair to punish me for things that are outside my control, 

I don't see how it's fair to play a game with someone that leaves for whatever reason.  If you leave only one game, then the system won't punish you outside of the warning I mentioned, if you do it again or have a pattern of leaving games, then you get punished.  As for the classic "things come up that take precedence", that's fine... if you're finding that this is happening frequently enough to where you are getting penalized for leaving games, then League is just not the game for you, simple as that.  

This is a team reliant game that requires a certain uninterrupted time commitment, if you cannot fulfill that obligation or feel that there is a *chance* that you cannot, then do not play.  You talk about fairness, but then fail to recognize the *fairness* regarding the other nine players that you punish by leaving (for whatever reason).  

>nor do I understand why you're making assumptions that this guy is lying when he has a perfectly valid point.

Because what he said doesn't make sense and if it doesn't make sense then it isn't true.  You don't get penalized for leaving one, and only one, game.

"You talk about fairness, but then fail to recognize the fairness regarding the other nine players that you punish by leaving" I do recognize that but sometimes_ it is not in my control_. I have played thousands of games and rarely leave. I rarely leave because I do not like leaving games because yes, it does suck when people leave. Tell me, where in my post do I fail to recognize the unfairness from both sides?

Two words, NET NEUTRALITY.

As the FCC rolled back 'net neutrality', ISP and cable providers will most likely throttle back gamers' connections to game servers. As this issue continues to gain optics by end-users and providers, the end of net neutrality will create increase in LB incidents.  My hope is RIOT will recognize the players have no control of 'throttling' and 'prioritization' that will undoubtedly affect the entire fan base.  In the next few months, RIOT should be monitoring this issue, CLOSELY, and return to modifying LB based on those findings.  I suspect many fans will find their games cut short, disconnected, and even blocked to game servers as providers and ISPs begin implementing 'pay to play' bandwidth, or be stuck at the bottom of bandwidth ladder for your region.
